title: Data-Driven Decision-Making Process for Early Detection of Skin Cancer

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners analyze real skin cancer image data to study early detection methods, with a focus on understanding basic principles of deep learning models and their application in healthcare

learning_goals: Explain core operational principles of deep learning models (e.g., VGG-16) for early skin cancer detection
Analyze real skin cancer image datasets to achieve ≥90% accuracy in identifying malignant lesions
Critically compare advantages and limitations of ensemble models in skin cancer diagnostic systems
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
